📊 Detailed Acoustic Measurements

Vortex Jazz Club - Reverberation Time by Frequency
Frequency Band Current (Vortex) Industry Standard Noise-Sensitive Target Status
125 Hz 0.66s 0.6-0.8s 0.5-0.65s ⚠️ Upper Range
250 Hz 0.56s 0.6-0.8s 0.5-0.65s ✅ Optimal
500 Hz 0.62s 0.6-0.8s 0.5-0.65s ✅ Good
1000 Hz 0.67s 0.6-0.8s 0.5-0.65s ⚠️ Upper Range
2000 Hz 0.76s 0.6-0.8s 0.5-0.65s ❌ Too High
4000 Hz 0.72s 0.6-0.8s 0.5-0.65s ❌ Too High
Tmf (500-2000Hz) 0.68s 0.6-0.8s 0.5-0.65s ⚠️ Needs Improvement
Volume (m³) 256 Venue Specific 📏 Reference
Acoustic Capacity 19 people 25-35 people 32+ people 📈 Below Target

🎯 Key Findings:

  • Industry Standard: Vortex meets general industry requirements (0.68s is within 0.6-0.8s range)
  • Noise-Sensitive Challenge: Higher frequencies (2000Hz, 4000Hz) exceed comfortable levels for noise-sensitive customers
  • Acoustic Capacity Gap: Only 19 people can communicate comfortably vs operational capacity of 80-100
  • Improvement Opportunity: Reducing RT to 0.5-0.65s range will significantly improve experience for 33% of customers

🔍 Understanding Acoustic Capacity

Acoustic Capacity measures how many people can comfortably communicate in a space without raising their voices. It's calculated by dividing the room's total sound absorption by the absorption coefficient for speech.

🎯 Your Venue's Current Situation:

19 Current Acoustic Capacity
(People who can speak comfortably)
80-100 Your Operational Capacity
(People you actually host)

⚠️ The Communication Challenge

Your venue currently hosts 80-100 people, but only 19 can speak comfortably without raising their voices. This means most conversations require increased volume, creating a cycle of noise that particularly affects noise-sensitive customers (30% of the population).

📈 Projected Improvements After Panel Installation

Vortex Jazz Club - Before vs After Panel Installation

🎯 Expected Improvements:

  • Mid-frequencies (500-1000Hz): Significant improvement in speech clarity
  • High-frequencies (2000-4000Hz): Reduced harshness for sensitive hearing
  • Overall Tmf: Reduced from 0.68s to 0.58s (within noise-sensitive range)
  • Acoustic Capacity: Increased from 19 to 32 people
  • Bar Area Focus: Conversation quality dramatically improved
  • Music Performance: Unaffected by targeted installation

🔧 What Are We Doing In Your Space

🎯 Strategic Bar Area Enhancement

We are installing detachable acoustic panels above the bar area only to ensure a vibrant music experience while optimising the room for conversation quality during break times.

This targeted approach maintains the live acoustic properties essential for jazz performance while creating a comfortable social space for interval conversations.

📋 Technical Details:

  • Material: Class A acoustic panels
  • Absorption Coefficient: 0.85-0.95 NRC (Noise Reduction Coefficient)
  • Installation: Detachable ceiling-mounted system
  • Coverage: Bar area only (preserves performance space acoustics)
🎵

Preserving Musical Integrity

Performance area remains acoustically unchanged for authentic jazz sound

👥 Observational Data: What Your Attendees Think

💬 Customer Feedback (5 Attendees Interviewed)

🔊 Current Challenges:

  • "Noise becomes an issue during busy periods"
  • "I have to find a suitable place in the audience so it's not overwhelming"
  • "Sometimes hard to chat during intervals"

💡 Key Insight:

Customers are already self-selecting quieter spots, indicating awareness of acoustic comfort needs.

Increasing your acoustic capacity from 19 to 32 people transforms the communication experience for everyone

Reduced background chatter means your audience can better appreciate musical performances at comfortable volumes

♿

Inclusive Access

Supports customers with hearing aids, tinnitus, autism, ADHD, and age-related hearing sensitivities
